title: Spoofing the Ai that monitors Postgame chat reporting .
body:
Just had a game where an enemy team player was being a total Jerk  .. 
Clearly un-afraid of any consequence .. Using out right hate words  Ni short for the N-bomb , and words like black slave... 
Between the fact that there is no more tribunals, and the reporting system is automated.. Do people like this who game chats actually ever get punished?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=mylittlep0wnee,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=hWp8QwbW,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-04-20T05:35:55.668+0000)
>
>  Do people like this who game chats actually ever get punished?

They do, if you report them.
***
What does any of this have to do with spoofing though?

I did, but that's another problem, when people on your team think its this guys 1st amendment right to say anything they want to say. Im pretty sure I was the only person from my team who reported him along with one of the guys own team mates.  But again, Febos, its all automated.. None of the words he used in itself are bad words, hence the "Dumb AI" wont find anything wrong with the chat.  This guy clearly had no fear of getting caught..

Yeah, I meant to say Fooling the AI, not spoofing. UGH (Was a bit annoyed when i wrote this and not thinking straight )

uuuggghhhhhh, you used "nd" instead of "st" so I'm going to assume this is not a mistype of 1st and 2nd.  I'm not entirely sure why your team think a person's right to bear arms have anything to do with someone's ability to say anything he wants....

> [{quoted}](name=mylittlep0wnee,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=hWp8QwbW,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-04-20T05:58:19.602+0000)
>
> when people on your team think its this guys 1st amendment right to say anything they want to say.

People on your country often forget that freedom of speech doesn't correlate to freedom of consequence.
You're indeed allowed to say whatever you want, but don't forget Riot isn't the US government. The 1st amendment "protects" you from your government, but it doesn't "protect" you from a private company.
We play Riot's game, so we must abide by their rules.

***
> [{quoted}](name=mylittlep0wnee,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=hWp8QwbW,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-04-20T05:58:19.602+0000)
>
> Im pretty sure I was the only person from my team who reported him

Great! You only need one report - yours - to trigger the system. More reports from a single game don't add weight to the punishment.

***
> [{quoted}](name=mylittlep0wnee,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=hWp8QwbW,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-04-20T05:58:19.602+0000)
>
> None of the words he used in itself are bad words, hence the "Dumb AI" wont find anything wrong with the chat.  This guy clearly had no fear of getting caught..

The system is more complex than that. It isn't a filter. In a nutshell, the IFS is like a collective brain of the community.
If the majority of the community agrees with you (meaning that behaviour is frown upon by most of us), then a punishment may happen.

Don't forget we don't always receive notifications for when punishments are issued. For all you know, he may have received a chat resctriction.
While the behavioral system is largely automated for verbal cases, Riot still does spot checks manually for fringe cases like what you mentioned.
Submit a support ticket https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new if you think that the IFS could miss flagging their behavior.
I'm not sure how this thread's title relates to the content of the post, but, to answer the latter, yes, players do occasionally get punished for negative behavior.
like bish instead of bitch and fak instead of fuck, or using 1's as L's and what not, yea im sure that the game detects some stuff like that

> [{quoted}](name=mylittlep0wnee,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=hWp8QwbW,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-04-20T05:35:55.668+0000)

> Do people like this who game chats actually ever get punished?

If their legitimately trying to bypass the system then it's a much lower chance that they'll get detected if at all. The offender you described is doing a bad job bypassing the system since he's using zero tolerance words (the n - word)
He wasn't using the Nword. He was using Ni to abbreviate the N word.  And also using "black slave" , clearly none of these words are bad taken at face value, hence why they wont get caught .
